data.subject: ¡Bienvenido a Miami!
data.message:
Let me just say this: I spent three years in the Bronx and Harlem. I walked home from the train at 4 am, I went to old school Harlem spots I had NO business going to...I went to an after hours spot in the Bronx that required express permission from the owner due to my lack of pigment... I went to block parties...to house parties...

I sideswiped someone in East New York, Brooklyn and rear-ended someone in Brownsville. I parked my ex's car, my rental cars, and my car all over Harlem, the Bronx, and Brooklyn.

...and nothing ever happened. Aside from old women talking shit to me on occasion, it was as though I had some sort of protective ghetto bubble around my ass at all times.


...and my first fucking night on South Beach, my car was stolen.

Yes, "welcome to Miami!" Cute.

The other day, I was picking my car up to leave the city. A redneck was attempting to park his big ass pickup in the same place, a garage next to my ex-office building. I stood and translated between the redneck and the parking attendant (who spoke not Spanglish, but rather only said the words he knew and kind of hummed to fill the spaces between words). The attendant said, "How long...hmmmm?"

"Well, I just want to walk on down there to the World Trade Center; I won't be all that long," said the redneck.

"Close....hmmmm...6. Is...hmm...oversize...10 dollar."

The redneck looked perplexed. "The garage closes at six and you have to pay a $10 oversize fee," I said.

"Now, how the heck am I oversized?"

And the last words I uttered in Manhattan:

"Welcome to New York!"

...but I assume he was able to retrieve his vehicle.
wow thats tough...good luck in mia
Yeah, well, if anything else happens, I blame you for not teaching me spanish.

data.subject: Knicks Continue to Suck Ass; Riley Says 'Fuck you, Eddie Curry!'
data.message:
The Knicks (16-38) were down 40 1:16 into the second half as the Sixers set season-highs in four categories and an arena high for first-half points in forging ahead by a mind-boggling 72-36 at intermission and a season-high in points.

The Sixers led 37-17 after one quarter, shooting 68 percent. The Sixers posted an incredible 14 first-half steals. With 5:40 left in the half, the lead ballooned to 58-28 after Rodney Carney stole the ball from Quentin Richardson (three turnovers, 1-of-5 from the field).


Asked if he ever considered skipping the meaningless game to head to New York yesterday to join general manager Glen Grunwald in fielding trade calls, the Knicks president/coach smiled, went speechless for more than 10 seconds and did not answer the question.

The trade values of Curry and Randolph have fallen so sharply it would seem difficult to make a major trade involving them that makes sense.

You couldn't trade Curry today for a dozen chocolate-frosted donuts.

Asked specifically about acquiring Curry at Wednesday's practice at American Airlines Arena, Riley said, "Wrong. Wrong. That's a blog bullshit Not that I don't have respect for him, but that's blog bullshit."


"I'm not just going to do something because [Jason Williams and Ricky Davis] have an expiring contract," Riley said. "Obviously, there are teams out there that want to unload things we don't want. I don't want 'em, and I don't care who they are."

I don't think a Nazi propaganda leader could spin a 40 point loss any better than this:

Headline: Knicks fall in Philadelphia 

Caption: Looking for their third victory in four games, the Knicks could not follow up an emotional win in Washington with another road triumph, dropping a 124-84 decision in Philadelphia on Wednesday. Eddy Curry got his offensive game going again with 12 points. 

www.nyknicks.com 

--
Haha, that's just amazing.  I watched them beat the 76ers at MSG a month or so ago.  Pathetic.
I"m boycotting them until something changes.
I go to boo Isiah, get wasted, and listen to the hilarious commentary from 25 year-old lifelong fans from Jersey.
The knicks move me to tears.
I'll be at MSG tonight in my Fire Isiah shirt.  Then again, I'm a Heat fan.  Hard to imagine a team sucking worse than the Knicks, but they manage.
